results.title: Kate and Anna McGarrigle
results.creator_credit: Derek Lamb, ONF | NFB and Caroline Leaf
results.brief_description: Using a combination of animation and documentary techniques, filmmaker Caroline Leaf has created an easygoing mood in this informal portrait of the acclaimed singer-songwriters from Quebec. Highlights of the film include excerpts from their dibut concert at Carnegie Hall; a look at the songwriting/recording process, McGarrigle style; and conversations with the sisters, their supporters, and their critics.

results.title: Karl Marx
results.brief_description: Academy award winner Bruce Petty has made this entertaining animation on the life and times of Karl Marx. Ambitious in its scope, the film attempts to put the economic history of Europe since the Industrial Revolution into a Marxist perspective. Narrators include Robyn Nevin, Arthur Dignam and Kate Fitzpatrick.

results.title: Kariba: power for Central Africa
results.creator_credit: Independent Television News (GB) and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: On 17 May 1960, Queen Elizabeth, the Queen mother, opened the Kariba Dam in Northern Rhodesia. The story of its construction and the difficulties which had to be overcome before the remote Kariba Gorge could become the biggest man-made lake in the world. Building a road into the Gorge; how floods disrupted progress; the power house; pouring the concrete and clearing the rising waters of timber. What the increased water supply and electric power will mean to Central Africa.

results.title: Kariba game rescue
results.brief_description: The rising waters of the Kariba Dam, largest man made lake in the world, threatened the wildlife in the area until Northern Rhodesian rescue teams put Operation Noah into practice. A typical day’s work is the capture of boatloads of game, such as antelope and zebra and their safe release on dry land.

results.title: Karatedo
results.brief_description: Action demonstrations of hand to hand combat, women’s self defence, and use of weapons in Karatedo as practised in Japan. Introduced by World Union of Karatedo Organisations President Ryoichi Sasakawa. In Japanese language - no subtitles.

results.title: Kansai: cradle of Japanese culture
results.creator_credit: Iwanami Productions and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: A colorful description of the Kansai district, including the major cities, Iso, Nara, Kyoto and Wakayama. This district was the stage for the drama of Japanese history and has been and always will be the cradle of Japanese culture.

results.title: Kanha National Park
results.brief_description: Kanha National Park in the hills of Madhya Pradesh. The park is noted for its rare Indian swamp deer, together with spotted deer, black buck antelope, tigers, langur, and Indian bison.

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 2 [Italian version]
results.brief_description: Part Two examines various varieties of the Kangaroo, such as the Rat Kangaroo and the Quokkas. The manner in which the Kangaroo has been able to adapt its form to suit the peculiarities of a variety of environments is stressed. Some rare species are noted in the examination of the relationship between the animal and its habitat

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 1. Biography [Italian version]
results.brief_description: Part 1: Overviews the evolution of the Kangaroo, tracing its development over fifty species, from tree-dwellers to the better-known “Big Red”. The feeding, and mating habits of various species are examined, also birth and development in the pouch are studied
